content.detailedDescription:
i was outside my home on 10/6/10 and again on 11/17/10 and was video taping flashing light's.  i filmed in front and behind the flashing object.  what my naked eye could not see....My camera sure did and what it captured was nothing less than awesome!  this object had a formation that started as a "v" shape and had so many other things "attached" to it, that is what makes this so incredible.
 
     on 11/17/10, i video taped numerous rotating lights in a mountain area, where there should have been nothing there at all. 

     this is really interesting......On 11/19/10, i contacted seti and told them of tapes...I have and what i've seen in the sky.  they asked me, " do you see anyone flying these things?"  i thought to myself, "what the heck, yeah they opened their window and waved at me".  needless to say, the conversation wasn't much longer after that comment.  the next day, 11/20/10, 2 military helicopters began circling the city along with...Jets.  i've lived here since 1997 and have never seen a military helicopter, let alone 2 at the same time.  i just thought it to be strange that after contacting seti, all of a sudden the military shows up.
content.shape: Boomerang,   Circle,   Disc,   Flash,   Square,   Rectagular,   Triangle
content.summary: Massive ufo!  similar sighting on nov. 17th. 2010

content.detailedDescription:
I was on my way to the movies with my wife. we live in king and queen county. drove across the newly constructed bridge in between king william and new kent co. and thats when we saw a total of 24 vertical jet vapor trails. these appeared all around in 360 degrees. i know it sounds ridiculous, but it looked like missles being launched!
that in itself was strange,but as we turned down the next road i saw a detailed dark object against the blue evening sky. it was nowhere near the previous things i described by the way. the object then pulsed an orange light,then moved slowly in an eliptical fashion then sped off.
the previous objects i described continued until dark and at no time did i observe any lights at all as per faa regulation. this is the most interesting thing i have ever observed in the sky. i cant belive i saw a ufo! 
if anyone else saw this please report!
content.summary: Metallic orblike eliptical movement pulsed orange light dashed off!

content.detailedDescription: I was heading northbound on 183 hwy after leaving the airport.  i noticed a dark triangle shaped craft moving very slowly over the army base area about 45 degrees up and to the left side of my vehicle, moving southward towards the airport.  it almost flew right above me so i pulled the van over to the side of the road and stopped the car just to get a better view of it.  it had a light on each angle and two more lights toward the middle of the bottom.  i watched it fly congruent to a jetliner as it was passing it by.  the jet wasn't very close to this object but this triangle object  was very low to the ground.  there were no apparent landing gear, it was just kinda cautiously approaching the airport. it dissapeared to the south after about 3 minutes...Since,it passed over the army base really low it gave me the impression that this was an experimental government aircraft. this triange was a little bigger than a 747 wingspan wise. this is the best description i can give. this is genuine. i don't have any photos because it was too dark and my cell phone takes lousy pics.  the attached pic is kinda what it looked like to me, just that the craft i saw was gunshot metal color.
content.summary: Triangle shaped object above fort brag

content.detailedDescription: "i am not filing this as a ufo report since i am a rocket scientist with extensive knowledge and experience of foreign and us spacecraft and aircraft of all descriptions. it is my professional opinion as a  past dod employee that this was not an aircraft or spacecraft from this planet, area 51, or any other secret base. it is not an ���unkown��� but clearly an et craft to anybody with a brain. the encounter started around 910 to 930 pm on 28nov2010 and i hastily departed the area at 9:43 pm. *(name deleted--cms/sg) and i had stopped at the railroad crossing between ca hy 70 and ca hy 20 eastbound on woodruff lane. it was a dark night with no lights and a clear starry sky. i stopped to see if any of my friends would show themselves and to look at the stars. the pleiades was almost directly overhead. to the west *(name deleted--cms/sg) noticed a ���flasher��� between jupiter (very bright) and another star to the south of it, i think this was all at about 45 degree elevation. she saw the flasher about 5-10 minutes after we stopped, i located it within 5 minutes later as it was flashing perhaps more than a minute between flashes. it was stationary. i continued to observe it throughout the encounter. a train was approaching in the distance, we were on a rise and it took maybe 10-15 minutes for the train to reach us. the flasher increased its rate of flashing until when i left it was flashing every 3 seconds. most of the flashes were dim but maybe every 8th or 10th flash was brighter than any stars and an adjoining flash was fairly bright also. the spacecraft started to move slightly just before the train lights became visible to the south. it moved in an arc that was easterly at first and then turned northerly towards me. it was almost directly overhead when i departed. i noted that although the craft appeared friendly to me, i became dizzy and they were attempting to immobilize me. i walked with difficulty around my car, backed up, and departed quickly, as i do not allow myself to be abducted if i can avoid it. i continued to be dizzy and disoriented even when i arrived home, but i called in my protection from lord ashtar and others. i believe they were friendly but not in the least concerned about any agreement from me to allow them to interfere, they were apparently concerned that i was quite aware of them and wanted to know who i was. i have a faculty to go back in time and will do so and investigate them further once i feel it is safe to do so. on the way home i made myself invisible and deflected their attention to the pickup truck far behind me. most ets have difficulty separating out individuals so they were able to follow me home but were somewhat confused about my location and identity. i was still somewhat dizzy and disoriented after arriving home, meaning that they were still trying to interfere or investigate me. i will wait until i am pretty sure they wont return before investigating their identity further. i note that they showed themselves by flashing and that encounters are interactive, ufos do not show themselves to everyone, so they apparently initiated this encounter, and i had stopped to observe any spacecraft that might choose to show themselves. i talked to them and had asked for whoever was up there to show themselves, and i am very telepathic for a human. there was no moon, no clouds, and perfect visibility in all directions. the flasher was brighter than jupiter at a bright flash and difficult to locate when it flashed dimly. i note that flashers are common, if they do not move they are not aircraft or spacecraft (satellites or secret rocket craft). helicopters can remain stationary but normally not for long periods and do not vary in intensity nor do they operate at high altitudes, and they have other colored running lights, not just a white flashing light, and it is not several minutes between flashes. the object appeared to be at high altitude, probably orbital altitudes but there is no reference to determine altitude."
content.summary: The following report (detailed description, below) is exactly as submitted to me by a personal friend of mine who wishes to remain anonymous.

content.detailedDescription: I was outside at 8:30 pm. there was some cloud cover to the west and to the north. at 8:45 pm there was almost complete cloud cover and no visible stars. by 9:00pm the cloud cover was almost completely clear in my viewing area. i noticed several planes, both to the east and to the west. there were several pairs of planes that appeared to be flying in formation to the east on a north heading. (too close to be commercial airliners) i was situated in a postion facing south at the darkest section of my yard. 9:10pm from directly overhead i saw a large blur coming from a direction behind me. i looked directly at the object and noticed that it blocked the view of the stars above it. there were no lights at all on the object. however there were six circular markings on the underside of the object. the six circular markings made an upside down v with the point of the v moving away from me. i had a pair of eleitz wetzlar 8x30 binoculars in my hands. i immediately veiwed the object with these. viewing this object through the binocluars i could only see the center portion of the object, with its outside portions outside my viewing. i could see all six of the circular markings on the underside of the object. the object in its entirety was triangular in shape. each point of the object was rounded and not pointed. at arms length measuring between thumb and first finger it was 5 inches in width and 3 inches in length. i would estimate speed to be close between 500 and 600 miles per hour with an altitude of 500 to 1000 feet. entirely silent. i lowered my binoculars and veiwed it flying away and out of view south. i timed the viewing of this object to be 10 seconds and noted the time. i immediately sketched to paper what i viewed as best as i could. i also noted that the object appeared solid because nothing could be seen above it. i waited 15 minutes longer viewing the same area of sky before going inside to type up what i viewed.
content.summary: Triangular, six circular markins on underside of craft of lighter coloer

content.detailedDescription: I arrived home from work at around 0615. as i exited my vehicle in the driveway i turned around to look at the mailbox. a light caught my eye high in the sky over the tree tops of my neighbors yard. the light was bright and high in the sky. within seconds it was at the tree line then came within 5 to 10 feet of the top of my neighbors house and the blue light fizzled out like the left overs of a firework. no further incident after this.
content.summary: Falling blue light, then the blue light flickered out like a firework .

content.detailedDescription:
This is an addendum to my previous report filed on 11-28-2010 titled, "shape-shifters:  peach-colored lights/orbs and hovering, fake planes."

i just want to add that the sightings have become a regular thing for me now in the evenings.  in my previous report, i mentioned that focused awareness seems to play a big part in whether these "things" materialize, and that continues to be the case.  as soon as i leave work at 5:00 p.M. and begin to think about the craft, it appears, almost like clockwork.  it continues to follow me for much of my commute home and occasionally seems to respond/react to certain thoughts i "send" it.  

on sunday evening (11-28-10), while driving home from work through dauphin county, this thing manifested in varying ways:  the standard peach-colored light that can be mistaken for an approaching plane; the fake craft that the peach-colored light morphs into; a craft that followed me over a mountain and erratically strobed a host of colors; and a similar craft that erratically strobed only red.  i flashed a flashlight at the thing from my car window a few times but was unable to notice any distinct flashes back other than the strobing that it was already doing.

tonight, however, the thing was bolder than ever and appeared in plain sight of thousands of cars on major traffic arteries during rush hour.  i was shocked by how bold this thing was:  it wasn't just a hovering orange light this time.  instead, it actually pulsed rhythmically (instead of strobing), about one pulse per second, while it hovered overhead (at about "plane altitude") and only occasionally moved about. it barely attempted to behave like a plane or other "normal" aircraft this time.. i saw it behave similarly about 25 miles down the road in a more rural area where it was really conspicuous.  in my mind i thought, "you should camouflage yourself more," and at that moment, it faded out and disappeared from view for a bit.

my feelings during these sightings vary from wonder, excitement, and hopefulness to feelings of being unnerved and disturbed. 

i really did not want to add more to my previous report, but i do want readers to know that there are folks out there who are experiencing daily sightings of these shape-shifters, whether we like it or not.  i realize how crazy all of this sounds, but i also don't really care about credibility or about proving anything at this point.  i'm merely posting this to acknowledge the experiences i've had and the craft/beings responsible for them, to inform and educate readers, and to be a voice for others experiencing the same phenomenon who are hesitant to make themselves known.

if these daily events change significantly (new type of craft or clear contact with an entity), i will be sure to file another report.  thanks, again.//
content.summary: Addendum to "shape-shifters" report filed 11-28-2010

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting on my back porch after having supper when i noticed a light moving from the west to the east. it was about as bright as the stars i could see and it's movement was what caught my eye. this was about 6:30pm. it was traveling about the speed that a satellite would travel as seen from the ground. i watched it for about 15 seconds before it disappeared behind a tree to the east of me. about five minutes later, as i was again scanning the sky, i saw another light flare up above a tree in my front yard, due south of my position. i didn't see the light until it flared on but i determined that it was moving from the southwest to the northeast. this time the light flared on for about two seconds then dimmed out for about two seconds then came back on. it did this three times before dimming out for good. i kept watching in the direction it was moving but didn't see it again. about five minutes after this another light flared on in about the same location as the one before this but this time it was traveling south to north. this one stayed lit for about five seconds before dimming out and disappearing. i again tracked it's course but didn't see it again. about five minutes later another light flared on what seemed to the west of my house. this time it was moving from the north to the south. the light stayed lit for about six to seven seconds and as it traveled south it seemed to zigzag slightly then it dimmed out and disappeared. i, again, scanned the direction it traveled and didn't see it again. this whole episode has me excited.
content.summary: Several lights, somewhat like a satellite going over head, traveling in different directions.

content.detailedDescription:
I was going to walmart at 3 am for black friday and we see this bright star that is about 5x brighter than venus. it begins to move so i film it and when i film it on the camera i cannot see it only complete darkness.  i lost track completely of 3 hours and next thing i know were driving home at 630 am and we go home and i look on my phone and there are 5 videos each between 5 seconds and 1minute and 51 seconds.  each video contains different spaceships and in 2 videos u can see humanoid figures in front of us and one runs up to me hits me and drags me off and the video ends.  please contact me and i  can send the videos and we can talk about what happened.  im quite frightened and my bellybutton has 2 tiny stitch like thing in it.  theres also a little metal something sticking out of it.  this evidence could truely be world changing and i'd appreciate contact.  also ive experienced extreme paranoia and almost as if soemthing is following me and constantly watching.  please give your assistance asap.  i will not post my videos here , theyre kind of private and the fact that you can see me being taken, i dont feel comfortable with multiple people seeing that at the moment. so one please contact me and i can privately send them and decide what to do.
sincerely *(wit's first name deleted--cms/sg).
content.shape: Boomerang,   Cigar,   Sphere,   Star-like,   Triangle,   Unknown
content.summary: I have videos of multiple space crafts at least 15 of them all different and non human figures in photots

content.detailedDescription: I was driving home from work on us1 and was thinking about my move to mt shasta and thinking how the times were changing and had the thought about a ufo then looked up in the sky and saw a bright light that was small very far in the distance.  i thought, could that be a ufo,  then this object came closer and became larger.  as i was stopped behind the cars in front of me i stared at the object and thought what if the light began to expand and then the object grew 4 times its original size then went back to being a speck, then i passed under some trees and when i was back out it was gone.
content.summary: Small circle bright light in the sky at dusk moved closer then expanded in size and shunk and expanded again

content.detailedDescription:
See attached document for details.

the attached images, if merged, come very close to the craft.

i'm working on the exact date since it coincides with a known event.
content.summary: Contact event - landed ufo with four beings

content.detailedDescription: I was taking photos in pilanesberg while being on holiday, down loaded the pictures from my camara to my laptop and notived that in the first pic that there was no shape next to the moon on the morning i took the pic, the second pic i took just a couple a seconds later shows the shape and the third doesn't.
content.summary: Was taking photos in pilanesberg nature reserve only discovered the shape once i was going through my pics

content.detailedDescription:
-time date nov 28th     10:30pm  

1. eastbound of highway 40 towards st. louis city from west county. *(names deleted--cms/sg) (my brother and his gf who are sitting here telling me this as i type it up) were listening to music and driving along the highway. *(name deleted--cms/sg) got a sudden urge to look out the window in the sky. they first thought it could've been a plane or helicopter but it was just really strange and too bright.  it was on the north side of the highway about a half mile up the road from st. johns hospital. they noticed it shortly after they passed over highway 270. they were going about 60mph.  
they noticed the ufo about a mile or so ahead. not sure what it was exactly yet. they kept watching as it wasn't moving. it had between 7-10 lights towards the top of it, red and white, bright. the red flashing about every 5 seconds. the white ones stayed on. the whole bottom of it was black and shaped like a classic style ufo/ the ufo was hovering above the treeline, it was a few inches above the treeline from their point of view from the highway. it was stationary, not moving.  looked to be about a half a mile away. it hovered there for what they guessed was about a minute, they were watching it as they passed by it, and it slowly lowered into the trees. fairly slowly. they were in shock and awe at seeing this. 


they lost sight as it lowered to the trees. 

they called me right after and i got to hear how freaked out/excited they were. 

they get sick and tired of me talking about ufos, so for them to be saying this is pretty legit. 
also i asked them what else they thought it could've been. they didn't say it was like anything. 
it could be a crazy lighted helicopter.. but yeah...

also they couldnt hear any sound.
let me know if you need any more info.


they're trying to draw it
content.summary: Disc with dome lights all around the top

content.detailedDescription: Coming home from work with my boyfriend and i stepped out of the car, stretched and i looked up at the clear night sky while he went to the end of his driveway to take trash cans in when i noticed (what i thought) was a shooting star...Or satellite. but the satellite changed direction, then my eyes adjusted to the darkness and i realized there were 2 lights in perfect unison moving in the same directions. when i focused even closer i noticed what was a very large, matte black figure shaped like an "l" or maybe a boomerang. it was a perfect geometric figure with two white, unblinking lights on each end, slowly moving/hovering above where we stood. no sound came from this thing, no other lights or blinking anything that might suggest it was a plane. it was too close to earth, and very large, making a 'beeline' or figure 8 above our heads. i yelled out to my boyfriend and asked "what the hell is that?!" and pointed at it, he looked and said "huh, it's a ufo!" at that point i freaked out and ran inside. a few weeks prior to that his sister had a bonfire in the backyard of the same location and the next day she came and told us she saw this ufo and tried to  draw her take on this thing and we laughed in disbelief at her. i am only reporting this now as i was looking through magazines online and came across a mufon cover with a similar shaped object and in small print to the right it said "sighted over dearborn, mi 2003". i was amazed. i had to report this!
content.summary: Black shadow agains clear night sky,  hovering above us, moving slowly no sound, 2 white lights on each end of figure

content.detailedDescription: This is a second-hand report from my father. my dad vacations every year for a week on the california coast in caspar (mendocino county). he is a very down-to-earth individual who during the whole time while growing up told me i was nuts if i believed in anything like ufo's or aliens. so when he told me he saw a big red-tinted, whitish circle over a full moon at about 2 am that was about twice the size of the moon and that it appeared above his eye-level at about 45 degrees and cast a shadow through a large window in the upstairs room he was sleeping in--it gave me pause. he stood in front of the window and watched it for about 10 minutes or so and then decided to go back to bed. it really shook him up. the shadows cast by it were almost as distinct as day-time shadows cast by the sun. he said it was like watching a moon-set and a sunrise except the sun doesn't rise at 2 am and the sun doesn't rise in the west. the more he tried to figure it out, the more it shook him up. and not being able to explain it right now is troubling for him. i've done some web searching and nobody appears to have reported a siting from caspar, mendocino or fort bragg, so i guess this is the first.
content.summary: "sun" seen over moon in caspar, california

content.detailedDescription: We were watching the fireworks at our lake in michigan,on july 4 2010...Immediately after the fireworks stopped...We saw approximately 15 of these objects flying in formation,from the south of the lake...They were flying in formation...Too slow to be planes and too fast to be balloons...They flew right over us,and everybody was saying..."what the heck is that"...They looked like giant jackolanterns lit up inside...We took several photos of the formation,but only one turned out!!!We have multiple witneses.
content.summary: Multiple wittnesses saw 15 of these flying over our lake immediately after firework display.

content.detailedDescription: I was with my family in the grand tetons about four to five years ago when i was 11 (i am now 16). we were at a lake there and i wanted to take a picture of the mountains behind the water. so, i took two pictures; both within the same minute and probably only a few seconds apart. the first picture shows a wide view of the lake, including the portion that is the second picture, and has no objects that resemble the significant object in the second picture. the second picture is altogether a different picture in which i had the same angle as the first, only i zoomed the camera in a little and took the picture only a few seconds after. you���ll notice that in the second picture there is an apparently fast-moving, rounded disc-like object in the sky. this object didn���t appear anywhere in the first picture, which is strange considering the larger view and the fact that it was only taken a few seconds earlier. i hadn���t noticed the image until later in the trip (i hadn���t reviewed the pictures until later) when we put the pictures on the computer and viewed them all. the pictures interested my family and me, but we never did anything about them. the third picture i enclosed is just a magnification of the section in the second picture of the object. that���s the most clarity my computer can give me at the amount of magnification that i did; at least to my knowledge. i wish there were some way that i knew of to enhance the photos, but i have neither the technology or the resources.
content.summary: Took 2 pictures within less than a minute of each other; first was normal, the second had fast-moving, disk-like object in it

content.detailedDescription: 2005: (arizona)  saw a band of light hovering above the ground, illuminating the entire farm.  feels it's alien in nature. possible telepathic influence. saw a pattern around the base of a cedar tree with an arrow. grew tired of seeing light and went back to sleep.
content.summary: Cms/mcm  band of light from sky on the ground.

content.detailedDescription:
we were at home.

taking pictures of the moon outside our bathroom window.

we noticed the object after we down loaded them onto our computer.

i have no idea what it is, light refraction? a bug on the screen? i did find it interesting enough to want to send it to someone.

both my wife and i were very curious when i zoomed in on the shot on our computer and adjusted the exposure. we got 2 or 3 different shots. we were making fun of each other about " ufo's " and how we got a picture. the more we looked at it the more it looked like something we could not explain. we love to take pictures, never took one like this!
 




same as above. witnessed by me and my wife. i did'nt photo shop the shots except to crop and stich the photos of the object i saw. probably nothing. you can decide.  the picture is all i saw. nothing while we were taking pictures caught our eye....Looks like a disc, with 4 lights, and some sort of vapor trail coming out of the bottom heading towards the ground.
content.summary: I took some pic's of the moon and when i processed them these images were on the picture.

content.detailedDescription: Me and my girlfriend witnessed what seemed to be a meteor flying accross the sky fairly low.  thing that got me the most and which made it unique was a couple of things 1- the emmence speed 2- the very low altitude 3- was bee lining straight across the sky but at an abnormal hieght for it to be so straight 4- what it did at the very end, flying erratically and then the upward swooping motion it made before disappearing. was extremely bright orange and red.  see alot of shooting stars up hear but never so orange before and so low.
content.summary: Misterious fireball-object

content.detailedDescription:
I'm a colombian citizen living in the city of kingston, jamaica. i love sunsets here, and yesterday's sunset was particularly beautiful, so i went out to the yard of the apartment that i rent to take some pictures of it. i loved the colors of a cloud that was above me, so i took a picture of it. at that moment i did not see anything unusual, and, as far as i can remember, there were no stars on the sky yet. however, when i downloaded the pictures to my computer, i noticed a bright spot in the upper left side of the picture of the cloud. like i said before, i didn't see anything at the moment when i took the picture, and i'm not sure if it is an star or a plane.
i think you might find the picture interesting, and that's why i'm submitting this report to you. and of course, i would love to know what the object on the picture is.

thank you.
content.summary: Ufo appeared on picture i took. i didn't realize about it until i downloaded the pics in my laptop

content.detailedDescription: Driving north on interstate 65 when we passed what looked like was a highschool football stadium on the left side of the highway. the red bottom of the craft, which was above and a little north of the football field, was the first thing that caught my eye. i pointed it out to my brother who was driving and we both stared at it for 10 seconds noticing that it was not moving at all and guessing it was about a 1,000 feet in the air. we both looked at his girlfriend in the back to get her attention to check it out and when we looked back it had vanished. complety gone. we looked all over the sky for it and couldn't find it. what made us think it was a ufo was how quick it disappeared and it's shape and hovering capabilities. mainly the speed of the disappearance.
content.summary: Could tell it was metal because the suns reflection was on it making it look like an orange ball. had a dome top and a flat bottom that looked like it was red.

content.detailedDescription:
The second or main ufo was seen falling from the sky down to the ground at a moderate pace, and was a bright reddish glow. (you could see the glow of high bright it was from the surrounding trees and brush) and it decended to the ground where i could only see it once in a while after that. also, let it be known that the drone craft above in all the same positions, were still in the same positions and continuing to bounce or dance in unison. 

make this also known, that this has happened on 2 nights in a row, on or around the same time each night. last night was the second night, as we almost were expecting it again, and all went outside to watch things develop.

i can give a detailed report via phone and i'd rather do it that way further if possible. also, i'd like to show you a possible landing zone and path of the descending object, so please call for further information.

*(wit's name deleted--cms/sg)
content.summary: 2 different craft - one directly above which was 2 spheres dancing in unison with each other. (there were several sets of these same dancing sets at what seemed like strategic positions surrounding the area.)

content.detailedDescription:
This is my description of a series of events that began in 1997, ceased for over a decade, and resumed just a few months ago in sept. 2010.  i've 
hesitated to report these events previously but do so now in the hopes that others like me will find the courage to break their silence and to share their experiences.  a staggering number of individuals have reported the same phenomena elsewhere online, and many have posted incredible footage on youtube of what i'm about to describe.  although i have not filmed the phenomena myself (yet), i can attest that the footage posted by users such as (names of websites moved to additional evidence section--cms/sg) are true to what i've witnessed myself.  i do not personally know these users, and i cite their videos only as further evidence of my witness testimony.

here's a synopsis of my experiences.  i've intentionally excluded certain details that i'd be willing to discuss confidentially with mufon investigators but do not wish to disclose in this forum or to third parties.  here are the basics:

it began on a late july evening in 1997 in northumberland co, pa, when i peered out my open window on an overcast night, as i often did, and looked 
skyward.  i recall the time was about 1:00 a.M.  in a period of time that spanned no more than one second at most, i saw an anomalous light strobe three times at three different points in the sky and disappear.  i felt certain that it was one light that had moved to three different points in the sky and had strobed three times at each point, rather than three different lights that strobed in succession, probably because the points were somewhat close to each other instead of at opposite sides of the sky.  i estimated the altitude of the light to be no more than that of a low-flying, small plane, although it could have been much closer than that.  in any case, i was practicing a religion at the time, i did not believe in extraterrestrials, and i was also an avid sky-watcher who had never witnessed anything like this, so this anomalous event knocked me for a loop and scared me terribly!  although it seems humorous in retrospect, i recall that i slept with the light on and with religious objects near my bed (and with my window closed) for several subsequent nights.  i pushed the event to the farthest corners of my mind, although it never quite escaped my memory.  

thirteen years passed, my belief systems changed greatly during that time, and i had opened myself to the likelihood of abundant, advanced intelligent life in this universe and countless other universes.  probably due to my 1997 experience, my interest was piqued when i read reviews of the recently released book by journalist leslie kean titled, "ufos."  i bought the book and finished it in september 2010.  it fascinated me, and i began to familiarize myself with the works and writings of various schools of thought on the subject, major researchers, groups, contactees, etc., trying to distinguish the real from the fake.  i truly believe that this "primed" me for what happened next.  that is, i think that the whole reason for my most recent sightings is that i had grown in awareness enough to be able to absorb and process the experiences.  i'm getting ahead of my story here, but suffice it to say that these events are purposeful and often interactive.  consciousness is key.

back to my account:

one evening in the last week of september 2010 in northumberland co., i was out for a walk/jog, which is routine for me in the warm months.  at the time, sundown was somewhere between 7 and 7:30 p.M.  i was walking/jogging toward the beautiful sunset, thinking about extraterrestrials, the books and literature i had just read, etc.  very few clouds were in the sky.  all of a sudden, i noticed an incredibly bright light in sunset.  too bright to be a star, as it shone with such a magnitude that it was not obscured by the brilliant sun.  plus, it appeared to be emanating from within the earth's atmosphere at about the altitude of a small plane.  the light was a peach color, like the color of the sunset.  it was stationary.  i laughed at myself, because i was caught off-guard by this light after just finishing the ufo book and reading all about ufos.  i figured that my imagination was running away with me, and i chided myself, thinking that i had mistaken the reflection of the sun gleaming off a plane, or the headlight of an approaching plane, for an anomalous light.  the fact was, though, that this light remained stationary for at least the 15 minutes that i walked/jogged in its direction, except for a few times when it moved slightly to the right or slightly to the left.  it also faded in and out--faded to a pinprick, then it would suddenly reappear and pulse brightly, then fade out, disappear, reappear, etc.  again, there were no clouds in the sky.  

despite all this, i convinced myself that it was nothing that couldn't be explained, and i didn't think anything further of it . . . until my next walk/jog a few days later, when it appeared again at the exact same place in the sky while i was thinking about ufos.  again, it faded in and out (not rhythmically--just randomly), moved here and there a bit, but just generally hovered.  it was close enough to me that i would have seen a craft/shape if it were an ultralight, glider, plane, certainly a balloon, parachuter, kite, etc.  on this second occasion, i paid closer attention and "knew" that . . . i was seeing exactly what i thought i was seeing.  i didn't feel fear--only immense curiosity and a certain sense of hopefulness and excitement.  i tried to mentally "talk" with the thing.  on subsequent walks, i may have even received rudimentary, yet personalized, messages back (although this is difficult to "prove," so i will exclude the details here.)

i should also mention that i reported seeing the anomalous light to my family members, who live next door and who do not believe even in the remotest possibility of extraterrestrials or sky phenomena originating from other beings.  on the morning after i had a sighting of the amber light, my father reported that a "helicopter" had landed atop the mountain about half a mile from our homes, observed about 6:00 a.M. as he was heading to work.  when i pressed for more details, he told me that he did not actually see a helicopter, but that the saw extremely bright lights that appeared to be landing atop the mountain.  his interpretation was that someone lived up there and may have needed helicopter transportation to a hospital.  i have not been able to confirm or refute this--i only mention it because he did not see a craft (only lights) and because of the next part of my story.

after the sightings of the bright, anomalous, peachy light during the last week of september and first week of october 2010, i stopped going for evening walks as it became too dark to do so.  i also had a series of urgent matters to take care of, and i ceased to even think about ufos for over a month.  i began to think about them again during the past week or two, perhaps to take my mind off other things, and that's when the most incredible part of my story began.

it was on or about november 17, 2010, when i was driving home from work (i commute 135 miles daily by car, mostly through rural areas).  i was in dauphin co. at the time, skywatching while driving (unsafe, i know), when a weird light caught my eye.  it seemed stationary, like a stationary plane light.  i had to keep looking back at the road between my views of it.  at one point, when i looked back at it, i saw that it was a plane.  

i was somewhat disappointed and kept driving.  when i reached a particular part of my commute (a small village in lower northumberland co.), i noticed an immensely bright light in the sky, hovering not far above tree-top level--perhaps a few hundred yards up, like the size of a small 
plane about to touch down in a few minutes, but lit up like a rocket!!!  it was ridiculously bright, and the brightness completely obscured the rest of the craft.  it was a long cigar (horizontally shaped, like an airplane lit up from wingtip to wingtip) of incredible brightness, just hovering, "looking" right at me!!  the brightness did not increase, decrease, or move--it was definitely hovering, or else moving at such a slow speed that it would have dropped from the sky if it were a typical plane.  by this time, i had slowed down to about 40 miles an hour.  a car approached in the opposite lane, i took my eyes off the "thing," and when i looked at it again, this time i saw just two incredibly bright "headlights" and two fainter lights on the wingtips of what appeared to be a plane.  it had begun to move toward me, but at a ridiculously slow pace.  it flew over me, from left to right.  my thoughts during the event were initially "what the h*** is that?"  just baffled curiosity, tinged with breathless excitement, and then a bit of a sheepish, confused feeling after i saw the "plane."

when i arrived home, i spoke with my father again and relayed what i had seen, because i felt like i needed to tell someone.  i was astounded when he casually informed me that he, too, had seen a bright "plane" that seemed to hover or fly unusually slowly.  he saw it in the exact same location as i did, and the object behaved exactly the same:  it flew over him from left to right.  he didn't tell me when the event occurred, but it must have been months ago, as he does not normally travel along that road.  "it was a plane," he said, with a tone of finality.  i didn't try to convince him otherwise.

a day or two later, i took an alternate route home from work due to an accident along my regular route, and i traveled through dauphin and schuylkill counties.  while i was waiting in a line of traffic to access i-81 n, i noticed the same "hovering plane" type of light in the sky among the other stars, airplanes, and jets.  its faintly peachy color gave it away.  i stared at it for a long time, waiting in traffic.  as i did, i noticed very faint strobe-like lights that seemed to emanate from it and travel around it.  for whatever reason, i once again wrote it off as a 
star with extremely distant jets in close alignment with it.  i continued to travel north. i looked at "it" once while driving on the interstate, and i thought i saw a contrail in the moonlight behind it, which befuddled (and disappointed) me yet again. 

i swear i saw the amber/peachy light again near a shopping center that i stopped at on my way home in schuylkill co.  (at the time, i was just 
dismissing everything i saw, so it's hard to recall details now in retrospect.)  then, after i left the shopping center, i witnessed almost a repeat of the previous event in lower northumberland co.:  a bright (but not nearly as bright as before) light seemed to hover, then "morph" into a plane-like object before proceeding to slowly fly over me from left to right!  because i was on a highway, i lost sight of the object after it flew over me and was behind me and behind trees surrounding the highway.

the most recent encounter(s) i had were on nov. 22 or nov. 23 after work.  i left work at 5:00 p.M. in dauphin co. and proceeded to walk several blocks to my car.  i saw a very, very strange looking "helicopter," complete with helicopter sound, flying right past me over the parking lot.  i couldn't see the shape of the helicopter very well, but it appeared to have a bright green light on top and a red light on the bottom.  this one may have been a domestic or military craft--i'm not saying it was unexplainable, just that i had never seen a light configuration like that before.

i proceeded to drive toward a shopping center in cumberland co.  while waiting in traffic, i saw the amber/peachy orb-like thing again in the sunset, facing me.  it looked at first like a plane approaching, but as i sat there in traffic for a good ten minutes or so, i realized that it was not increasing in size in the slightest, nor was it decreasing, fading, pulsing, or otherwise moving.  it was, however, glimmering--dancing, even--in an odd way, more so than the typical glimmer of a star in the sky.  it seemed to be multi-colored at times.  finally, as traffic cleared and i drove across a bridge toward the light, it began to approach, take the form of a plane, and turn to my right at a 90 degree angle.  i took my eye off it to watch the road, looked back, and all of a sudden, this thing flew right-to-left, right over me!  it had done a complete 180 in the second or two that i had taken my eyes off the road.  

despite all this, i was just left feeling bad because these objects were merely planes, and i was seemingly incapable of identifying them as such.  i thought i was perhaps misidentifying things.

after some shopping in cumberland and dauphin counties, i proceeded home.  while in upper dauphin co., in the area where i had previously seen a hovering light, i noticed a very odd-looking "plane."  instead of the typical white light "strobe" that domestic craft have, this plane's strobe light "fluttered" in a bizarre way.  i'm sorry that i cannot describe it better than that.  suffice it to say, it was an abnormal type of strobe that i had never seen before.  again, i'm not completely convinced that this particular one wasn't just a regular plane with a broken light or something.

finally, when i had reached the part of my commute through lower northumberland county, in the exact same place that i had first seen the bright, cigar-shaped-light-turned-hovering-plane, and in the exact same place that my father had seen something similar, i saw it again!!!  it wasn't as bright this time, but it was bright, peachy-colored, and hovering on the opposite bank of the susquehanna river.  i mentally asked it to come closer, to show me what it really looked like.  at this point, i was driving about 35 mph and looking for a place to pull over.  i suspected that this was the "real deal," and i wanted an opportunity for me to observe it without moving.  i pulled over at the first opportunity and opened my window.  

i had lost view of the light behind some trees for a bit but soon saw it through the tree tops, slowly making its way toward me (it was flying about a few hundred yards up in the air from left to right again).  finally, it cleared the trees, and i stuck my head out the window and saw it:  it was a small, low-flying jet/plane, complete with 
plane-like sound, much to my consternation.  

when i arrived home, i performed internet searches on "hovering planes" and "ufos that become planes."  this led me to the videos of many youtubers who have been observing and capturing these things for quite some time.  the usernames i mentioned above are just a few who have posted videos of exactly what i saw:  peachy orbs/lights that morph into plane-like objects.  some of the videos even show daylight footage.  i cannot emphasize enough that these are legit, and i encourage anyone even remotely interested to take a look.  i thought i was a really poor witness until i viewed these videos, at which point i almost wept when i realized that others have seen what i've seen.  the "orange orb/fake-plane ufo" thing is real, it's prevalent, and many of us are witnessing it, worldwide.

as for my opinion about what these are and why they're here (for what it's worth):  i believe they're extraterrestrial in origin.  not sure whether they're "manned," as it were, or perhaps just probes or holograms.  they don't appear to do anything except observe, and, occasionally, interact.  they seem to appear when one thinks about them, almost exclusively on clear nights. i believe that they are simply trying observe and to spread awareness of their existence at a grass-roots-level.  they are both bold and cautious--they're undaunted by urban areas, where they can blend in, but rural areas and daylight seem to be no big deals, either.  i would love to know why there are so many of these, and why "they" seem to want to be noticed.

thanks for the opportunity to provide my personal account of this phenomenon.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Other
content.shape: Cigar,   Cylinder,   Flash,   Sphere,   Star-like,   Other
content.summary: Shape-shifters:  peach-colored lights/orbs & hovering, fake planes

content.detailedDescription:
My husband and i were driving through southern new mexico, approximately 30 miles north of las cruces. i commented on the beauty of the clouds, as chemtrailing seemed to be absent or minimal that day, and took a photo using my digital camera. i did not see anything unusual in the sky at the time; however, when i uploaded the image to my computer i was very surprised to see something in the upper left hand portion of the picture which looked like a metal hinge of sorts with several squarish openings in it. my husband and i looked at it with wonder, first discussing if it could be a reflection from anything inside the car. we determined that it could not be that, and remarked at how the ufo image was embedded within the clouds -- clouds in front and behind. (the attached image of this ufo has not been altered in any  way. you will see that it is in a "photoshop" file but i do not even have photoshop enabled on my computer. it is simply the way my pictures get stored.) later, i noticed small, light, circular objects lower in the picture. i don't know if these are related to the ufo or if they are the result of moisture or other factors. i have very limited photography knowledge. 

just a few days ago, i was viewing a link provided in kerry cassidy's blog on the project camelot portal [link moved to additional evidence section cms/dr]  
when i saw frame #iss-007-e06886, "unidentified" object photographed outside iss during expedition 7, i recognized the similarity to the ufo in my picture. very strange . . . i have e-mailed ms. cassidy in this regard but have not yet heard back from her. i am sending this to mufon, as i think     it is important to do so. thank you for all your efforts.

best regards,
[name removed cms/dr]
content.summary: I was taking a picture of the sky and did not see the ufo at all. i noticed it when i uploaded the image to the computer.

content.detailedDescription: on the evening of nov. 27. my nephew and i exited my house to ride atv to  check hog trap.  we first noticed a bright low altitude light moving southwestarly.  it was silent and seemed to be floating along like a fishing bobber in the water.  object was relatively close but not discernable by the naked eye.  i ran back in and grabed some binoculars.  i could not believe what i was seeing. it  had a disc shaped helm that was a row of lights.  these lights were a bright whitish blue kind of color. they were pulsing from one end of arc to the other and also flashing in random sequences as well.  i gave my nephew the binoculars and immediately started saying i dont believe this something is not right.  its a disc its a disc.  we were both a bit in dis-belief.  the object was vanishing behind a northsouth fence/tree line.  we drove around and out into the open in front pasture.  here most all of the sky is visible.  we proceeded to watch the object until it stopped and appeared to hover in one spot far off above the southwest horizion.  upon gazing around the sky we statred to notice several objects all over the sky.  there were several that were flying low on the northwestern horizion headed southwest. at first they were bright yellowish lights and appeared quite large.  they would begin to flash and display different colors of light.  some times there were three to four of these in fairly close proximity.  some times they moved toward each other and at other times they would almost touch and then move away from each other one heading northward and the other southward, both moving at the same rate.  there were also objects moving south to north.  these would fly almost directly over head and made almost no noise.  they sounded kinda like a jet engine,but with a much quiter tone.  these are what i call the flying bars.  they had two whitishyellow lights on each end.  in between were several different lights flashing, pulsing, and possibly changing color.  it was hard to tell with our crappy binoculars but you could definately see the lights on these objects.  there were also objects that were rectangular flying light panels.  these objects had the most lights and the most different colors.  there were reds, blues, greens, ambers, white, orange, purple, and possibly more.  all flashing, pulsing, some steady, some blinking and some possibly moving.  the objects moved at a fairly slow rate of speed but speed up and slow down as well as go up and down at times appearing to just "float" around.  we also witnessed triangular shaped light arrays on some of these objects.  these had bright whitishblue lights on three points with many other lights in between and inside the triangular shape.  i was watching a statonary very bright orangish one low in the southwest sky.  it pulsed brightly and vanished.  then there were several smaller flashing flying objects.  my report is a little scattered because i was really rattled by all this and there was so much happening.  we watched the show in total disbelief for about an hour.  upon a break for some turkeyday leftovers we both independently drew simple pictures/diagrams of what we had witnessed.  we drew three of the same objects and two that were quite similar.  we saw triangular, discshaped, square/rectangular objects.The only really good closeup view was of the initial craft with a definite arc of lights on its helm. at approximatly ten p.M. i went back out on atv and almost all activity had stopped.  there were still a couple of strange objects around but nothing like what we had previously witnessed.  its about eleven on sunday morning so my details are a bit lacking.  we never could really see what the objects were or looked like except for the amazing mumber,color, and actions of the lights on these craft.  i have seen some weired stuff in my day but this takes the cake.  i live on the outside test loop for majors field in greenville, texas.  the airforce has taken control of some stuff out there.  i dont know if there is any connection but its worth noting.  thank you for your time, and no for once i was not drunk on a saturday night.  i feel today like im crazy because i cant hardly believe what we actually saw.  could ten airplanes be seen at any given time at numereous places, variable velocity and trajectory in the sky for over an hour?
content.shape: Chevron,   Disc,   Flash,   Square,   Rectagular,   Triangle,   Other,   Unknown
content.summary: At any given time about ten objects in sky all around.  objects had multiple light arrays and colors strobing, flashing and pulsing.

content.detailedDescription:
On a clear day in may, a friend and i were hiking at smith rock park near redmond, oregon. we took several photos and as you can see by the photo it was a very clear sky with little atmospheric cloud development as we were under a high pressure system at the time. we never saw the object personally. it was something we noticed in the photo only recently after enlarging it. i did see another very similar object in the same area the year before oddly enough, but didn't have a camera at that time. 
my experience is as a combat weather technician for the usaf and i am trained to spot and recognize all types of atmospheric phenomena as well as aircraft from around the world. the object in the photo is not a craft i recognize, nor was it visible to the naked eye. it did not show up in any other pics i took that day.
content.summary: Object showed up in photograph!

content.detailedDescription:
We had been at a friends house outside madison, ga, for dinner and stayed to watch a football game. after the game there were 9 of us standing outside talking and getting ready to leave. the time was approximately 11:45 pm. the owner of the house noticed an extremely bright light in the sky just above the treeline that, at first, seemed stationary at an approximate distance of one to two miles (best estimate without knowing the exact size of the object). the light began to move slowly, at times getting closer but moving on a northwesterly course. we observed the object for approximately 15 minutes before it disappeared behind the far treeline. it was clearly not an airplane or helicopter, but we thought it might be a blimp. however, there were no collision lights visible on the object, only bright whitish-blue lights covering what appeared to be the length of the object. the object seemed to glow. when viewing it through binoculars, the object appeared to have a dome-like structure on the top and a glowing ring encircling the bottom of the object. we could hear no sound coming from the object as it moved.

the overwhelming reaction from everyone was that it was like nothing anyone of us had ever seen before. a couple of us kept saying that it had to be a blimp, simply because that was the only thing we knew of that would be moving at that speed and altitude. several people thought we should call the police, but we decided not to for the sake of seeming like we were crazy. my wife, son and i had about a 65 min drive home. when we got home she was still so shaken that she did not want to go into the house alone or go outside when i took our dogs out.

at 12:01 am a friend in monroe, ga, approximately 15 miles to the northwest of the location from which we observed the object, sent us a text message that she had just seen the same object pass overhead. her description of the object was similar to our observation - an oval object with what appeared to be a ring around it moving slowly with bright lights covering it.
content.summary: Bright light hovering above the trees.

content.detailedDescription:
Driving along salem road from interstate 20 towards brown bridge road. object caught my eye because it was too big to be a plane, the shape was different and the lighting was solid. the shape was blimp like, but the shape was almost like a domed serving platter. the object first appeared to be hovering and then it was moving off towards the west (i think). i was trying to drive and keep the object in my view. i did stop and try to get a better look, but then the trees blocked my sight. it was also moving away from me and getting smaller. 

as i lost site, i got back on salem road and turned onto brown bridge road heading towards mcdonough. i caught site of the object again but it was moving away and the trees were blocking my view. i tried to keep up with it and eventually lost it completely. 

i remember feeling like i could not be the only one seeing this. i thought about it just being a blimp, but the time and the look did not make me believe it was anything short of abnormal. after arriving home, i searched the skies without any luck. i immediately searched the internet to see if anyone had reported seeing it. i know that i saw something other than an ordinary aircraft.

i regret not having a camera available to get a picture.
content.summary: Sighting over conyers, ga around 12am on november 28 2010

content.detailedDescription: I was riding home from maryland with my parents. i was a passenger in the front of a vw van. we were entering the outskirts of reading pa. as i looked at the sky two (what looked to be fixed) star like lights were speeding toward the highway and spreading apart suggesting they were on either side of a huge dark craft at an estimated 2 to 3 thousand foot altitude descending  toward the crowded highway at great speed. the white lights were star like and unremarkable save for speed at which they approached and the slight intensification(brightening) of the lights in combination with the spreading of the 2 points of light (again) suggesting to the eye that these lights were fixed upon a huge craft.  the lights then stopped approaching (spreading) abruptly and the light on the left moved in a quick diagonal curve coming to rest above the right light and to what was the right light's right. the distance between the two lights remained generally constant during this diagnal motion. the speed of this motion was very fast and the light stopped on a dime at a speed beyond any conventional craft almost suggesting that the entire structure rotated and stopped very quickly (half a second)  buildings and trees periodically blocked my view very briefly as the van drove down the highway but from what i could discern, the lights remained in the sky simply looking like stars. then the top light changed color to an dull orange  with a flashing red light on top and flew off slowly looking like a completely conventional midsized aircraft at a perhaps 7 to 8 thousand feet while the lower light stayed stationary like all the other stars in the sky. we did not stop the van and my parents did not see this at all. these lights were unremarkable and looked like stars or distant aircraft but their movements were completely unconventional clearly creating g forces beyond human tolerences. i was overwhelmed. if these lights were fixed points at either end of a rigid structure the craft would be huge the highway was crowded and the area was populated and the night was clear but one would really have to be studying that area of the sky to notice these movements. between the lights i could discern no outline of a craft only darkness which blended into a clear night sky obscured by a the ambient light of a large city. so i couldn't discern an abscence of stars between the two points. so i can't say for certain that there was a large craft but the movements of the lights were unconventional and unlike anything i've ever witnessed, even taking into account my lack of depth perception as i had no real reference for comparitive distance. i told my parents immediately but the unconventional maneuvers had ceased within brief seconds although the 2 points of light stayed in the sky for a long period as one flew away in a completely conventional presentation. the highway was crowded and we simply continued to drive home. admittingly it was hard to get an absolute fix on these points of light when trees and buildings obscurred the sky as the van drove down the highway so i can't be sure of the last part of the story when the top object seemed to transform into a conventional craft presentation but the initial movements were seen clearly without obstruction and were remarkable.
content.summary: Two (what looked like fixed lights) descending at very fast speed then one light moved at impossible angle stopping on a dime
